'Marshall William Faulk' (born February 26, 1973) is a former American college
and professional football player who was a running back in the National Football
League (NFL) for twelve seasons. He played college football for San Diego State
University, and was a three-time All-American. He was selected by the
Indianapolis Colts as the second overall pick in the 1994 NFL Draft, and he also
played professionally for the NFL's St. Louis Rams. Faulk is one of only three
NFL players (Marcus Allen and Tiki Barber being the others) to reach at least
10,000 rushing yards and 5,000 receiving yards; he is the only one to amass
12,000 yards rushing and 6,000 yards receiving. Rose, David; Baxter,
Russell. [http://sports.espn.go.com/nfl/draft07/news/story?id=2849944 "Top 10:
Best No. 2 picks of all-time"], [[ESPN.com]], April 26, 2007. He was
elected to the Pro Football Hall of Fame in 2011.

He is currently a pro football analyst for [[NFL Total Access]], [[Thursday
Night Football]], and NFL GameDay Morning on the NFL Network.
